items.label: Abridger
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by shortening or condensing the original work but leaving the nature and content of the original work substantially unchanged. For substantial modifications that result in the creation of a new work, see author.

items.label: Actor
items.description: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by acting as a cast member or player in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.

items.label: Adapter
items.description: A person or organization who 1) reworks a musical composition, usually for a different medium, or 2) rewrites novels or stories for motion pictures or other audiovisual medium.

items.label: Addressee
items.description: A person, family, or organization to whom the correspondence in a work is addressed.

items.label: Analyst
items.description: A person or organization that reviews, examines and interprets data or information in a specific area.

items.label: Animator
items.description: A person contributing to a moving image work or computer program by giving apparent movement to inanimate objects or drawings. For the creator of the drawings that are animated, see artist.

items.label: Annotator
items.description: A person who makes manuscript annotations on an item

items.label: Announcer
items.description: A person who makes announcements on television or radio to identify stations, introduce and close shows, announce station breaks, commercials, and public service information. May also read news flashes and describe other public and sporting events.

items.label: Appellant
items.description: A person or organization who appeals a lower court's decision.

items.label: Appellee
items.description: A person or organization against whom an appeal is taken.

items.label: Applicant
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the submission of an application or who is named as eligible for the results of the processing of the application (e.g., bestowing of rights, reward, title, position).

items.label: Architect
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating an architectural design, including a pictorial representation intended to show how a building, etc., will look when completed. It also oversees the construction of structures.

items.label: Arranger
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a musical work by rewriting the composition for a medium of performance different from that for which the work was originally intended, or modifying the work for the same medium of performance, etc., such that the musical substance of the original composition remains essentially unchanged. For extensive modification that effectively results in the creation of a new musical work, see composer.

items.label: Art copyist
items.description: A person (e.g., a painter or sculptor) who makes copies of works of visual art.

items.label: Art director
items.description: A person contributing to a motion picture or television production by overseeing the artists and craftspeople who build the sets.

items.label: Artist
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work by conceiving, and implementing, an original graphic design, drawing, painting, etc. For book illustrators, prefer Illustrator [ill].

items.label: Artistic director
items.description: A person responsible for controlling the development of the artistic style of an entire production, including the choice of works to be presented and selection of senior production staff.

items.label: Assignee
items.description: A person or organization to whom a license for printing or publishing has been transferred.

items.label: Associated name
items.description: A person or organization associated with or found in an item or collection, which cannot be determined to be that of a Former owner [fmo] or other designated relationship indicative of provenance.

items.label: Attributed name
items.description: An author, artist, etc., relating him/her to a resource for which there is or once was substantial authority for designating that person as author, creator, etc. of the work.

items.label: Auctioneer
items.description: A person or organization in charge of the estimation and public auctioning of goods, particularly books, artistic works, etc.

items.label: Audio engineer
items.description: A person or organization contributing to a resource by managing the technical aspects of sound during the processes of recording, mixing, and reproduction.

items.label: Audio producer
items.description: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of an audio recording.

items.label: Author
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work that is primarily textual in content, regardless of media type (e.g., printed text, spoken word, electronic text, tactile text) or genre (e.g., poems, novels, screenplays, blogs). Use also for persons, etc., creating a new work by paraphrasing, rewriting, or adapting works by another creator such that the modification has substantially changed the nature and content of the original or changed the medium of expression.

items.label: Author in quotations or text abstracts
items.description: A person or organization whose work is largely quoted or extracted in works to which he or she did not contribute directly. Such quotations are found particularly in exhibition catalogs, collections of photographs, etc.

items.label: Author of dialog
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the dialog or spoken commentary for a screenplay or sound recording.

items.label: Autographer
items.description: A person whose manuscript signature appears on an item.

items.label: Bibliographic antecedent
items.description: A person or organization responsible for a resource upon which the resource represented by the bibliographic description is based. This may be appropriate for adaptations, sequels, continuations, indexes, etc.

items.label: Binder
items.description: A person who binds an item.

items.label: Binding designer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the binding design of a book, including the type of binding, the type of materials used, and any decorative aspects of the binding.

items.label: Blurb writer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for writing a commendation or testimonial for a work, which appears on or within the publication itself, frequently on the back or dust jacket of print publications or on advertising material for all media.

items.label: Book artist
items.description: A person who is responsible for exploiting the book form or altering its physical structure.

items.label: Book designer
items.description: A person or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by being responsible for the entire graphic design of a book, including arrangement of type and illustration, choice of materials, and process used.

items.label: Book producer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the production of books and other print media.

items.label: Bookjacket designer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the design of flexible covers designed for or published with a book, including the type of materials used, and any decorative aspects of the bookjacket.

items.label: Bookplate designer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the design of a book owner's identification label that is most commonly pasted to the inside front cover of a book.

items.label: Bookseller
items.description: A person or organization who makes books and other bibliographic materials available for purchase. Interest in the materials is primarily lucrative.

items.label: Braille embosser
items.description: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by embossing Braille cells using a stylus, special embossing printer, or other device.

items.label: Broadcaster
items.description: A person, family, or organization involved in broadcasting a resource to an audience via radio, television, webcast, etc.

items.label: Calligrapher
items.description: A person or organization who writes in an artistic hand, usually as a copyist and or engrosser.

items.label: Camera operator
items.description: A person who operates a motion picture camera to film a moving image resource.

items.label: Cartographer
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a map, atlas, globe, or other cartographic work.

items.label: Caster
items.description: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by pouring a liquid or molten substance into a mold and leaving it to solidify to take the shape of the mold.

items.label: Casting director
items.description: A person responsible for most aspects of assigning roles and duties to performers.

items.label: Censor
items.description: A person or organization who examines bibliographic resources for the purpose of suppressing parts deemed objectionable on moral, political, military, or other grounds.

items.label: Choreographer
items.description: A person responsible for creating or contributing to a work of movement.

items.label: Cinematographer
items.description: A person in charge of photographing a motion picture, who plans the technical aspets of lighting and photographing of scenes, and often assists the director in the choice of angles, camera setups, and lighting moods. He or she may also supervise the further processing of filmed material up to the completion of the work print. Cinematographer is also referred to as director of photography. Do not confuse with videographer.

items.label: Client
items.description: A person or organization for whom another person or organization is acting.

items.label: Collection registrar
items.description: A curator who lists or inventories the items in an aggregate work such as a collection of items or works.

items.label: Collector
items.description: A curator who brings together items from various sources that are then arranged, described, and cataloged as a collection. A collector is neither the creator of the material nor a person to whom manuscripts in the collection may have been addressed.

items.label: Collotyper
items.description: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of photographic prints from film or other colloid that has ink-receptive and ink-repellent surfaces.

items.label: Colorist
items.description: A person or organization responsible for applying color to drawings, prints, photographs, maps, moving images, etc.

items.label: Commentator
items.description: A performer contributing to a work by providing interpretation, analysis, or a discussion of the subject matter on a recording, film, or other audiovisual medium.

items.label: Commentator for written text
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the commentary or explanatory notes about a text. For the writer of manuscript annotations in a printed book, use Annotator.

items.label: Compiler
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new work (e.g., a bibliography, a directory) through the act of compilation, e.g., selecting, arranging, aggregating, and editing data, information, etc

items.label: Complainant
items.description: A person or organization who applies to the courts for redress, usually in an equity proceeding.

items.label: Composer
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a musical resource by adding music to a work that originally lacked it or supplements it.

items.label: Compositor
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the creation of metal slug, or molds made of other materials, used to produce the text and images in printed matter.

items.label: Conceptor
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the original idea on which a work is based, this includes the scientific author of an audio-visual item and the conceptor of an advertisement.

items.label: Conductor
items.description: A performer contributing to a musical resource by leading a performing group (orchestra, chorus, opera, etc.) in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.

items.label: Conservator
items.description: A person or organization responsible for documenting, preserving, or treating printed or manuscript material, works of art, artifacts, or other media.

items.label: Consultant
items.description: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who is called upon for professional advice or services in a specialized field of knowledge or training.

items.label: Consultant to a project
items.description: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who is engaged specifically to provide an intellectual overview of a strategic or operational task and by analysis, specification, or instruction, to create or propose a cost-effective course of action or solution.

items.label: Contestant
items.description: A person(s) or organization who opposes, resists, or disputes, in a court of law, a claim, decision, result, etc.

items.label: Contestee
items.description: A person(s) or organization defending a claim, decision, result, etc. being opposed, resisted, or disputed in a court of law.

items.label: Contractor
items.description: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who enters into a contract with another person or organization to perform a specific task.

items.label: Contributor
items.description: A person, family or organization responsible for making contributions to the resource. This includes those whose work has been contributed to a larger work, such as an anthology, serial publication, or other compilation of individual works. If a more specific role is available, prefer that, e.g. editor, compiler, illustrator.

items.label: Copyright claimant
items.description: A person or organization listed as a copyright owner at the time of registration. Copyright can be granted or later transferred to another person or organization, at which time the claimant becomes the copyright holder.

items.label: Copyright holder
items.description: A person or organization to whom copy and legal rights have been granted or transferred for the intellectual content of a work. The copyright holder, although not necessarily the creator of the work, usually has the exclusive right to benefit financially from the sale and use of the work to which the associated copyright protection applies.

items.label: Corrector
items.description: A person or organization who is a corrector of manuscripts, such as the scriptorium official who corrected the work of a scribe. For printed matter, use Proofreader.

items.label: Correspondent
items.description: A person or organization who was either the writer or recipient of a letter or other communication.

items.label: Costume designer
items.description: A person, family, or organization that designs the costumes for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment.

items.label: Court governed
items.description: A court governed by court rules, regardless of their official nature (e.g., laws, administrative regulations).

items.label: Court reporter
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by preparing a court's opinions for publication.

items.label: Cover designer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the graphic design of a book cover, album cover, slipcase, box, container, etc. For a person or organization responsible for the graphic design of an entire book, use Book designer; for book jackets, use Bookjacket designer.

items.label: Creator
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the intellectual or artistic content of a resource.

items.label: Curator
items.description: A person, family, or organization conceiving, aggregating, and/or organizing an exhibition, collection, or other item.

items.label: Dancer
items.description: A performer who dances in a musical, dramatic, etc., presentation.

items.label: Data contributor
items.description: A person or organization that submits data for inclusion in a database or other collection of data.

items.label: Data manager
items.description: A person or organization responsible for managing databases or other data sources.

items.label: Dedicatee
items.description: A person, family, or organization to whom a resource is dedicated.

items.label: Dedicator
items.description: A person who writes a dedication, which may be a formal statement or in epistolary or verse form.

items.label: Defendant
items.description: A person or organization who is accused in a criminal proceeding or sued in a civil proceeding.

items.label: Degree committee member
items.description: A person who is part of a committee that considers the merit of a thesis, dissertation, or other submission by an academic degree candidate.

items.label: Degree granting institution
items.description: A organization granting an academic degree.

items.label: Degree supervisor
items.description: A person overseeing a higher level academic degree.

items.label: Delineator
items.description: A person or organization executing technical drawings from others' designs.

items.label: Depicted
items.description: An entity depicted or portrayed in a work, particularly in a work of art.

items.label: Depositor
items.description: A current owner of an item who deposited the item into the custody of another person, family, or organization, while still retaining ownership.

items.label: Designer
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a design for an object.

items.label: Director
items.description: A person responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance, a radio or television program, etc.

items.label: Dissertant
items.description: A person who presents a thesis for a university or higher-level educational degree.

items.label: Distribution place
items.description: A place from which a resource, e.g., a serial, is distributed.

items.label: DJ
items.description: A person who mixes recorded tracks together during a live performance or in a recording studio to appear as one continuous track.

items.label: Donor
items.description: A former owner of an item who donated that item to another owner.

items.label: Draftsman
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by an architect, inventor, etc., by making detailed plans or drawings for buildings, ships, aircraft, machines, objects, etc.

items.label: Dubbing director
items.description: A person responsible for the general management and supervision of adding new dialog or other sounds to complete a soundtrack.

items.label: Dubious author
items.description: A person or organization to which authorship has been dubiously or incorrectly ascribed.

items.label: Editor
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by revising or elucidating the content, e.g., adding an introduction, notes, or other critical matter. An editor may also prepare a resource for production, publication, or distribution. For major revisions, adaptations, etc., that substantially change the nature and content of the original work, resulting in a new work, see author.

items.label: Editor of compilation
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a collective or aggregate work by selecting and putting together works, or parts of works, by one or more creators. For compilations of data, information, etc., that result in new works, see compiler.

items.label: Editor of moving image work
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for assembling, arranging, and trimming film, video, or other moving image formats, including both visual and audio aspects.

items.label: Editorial director
items.description: A person or organization having legal and/or intellectual responsibility other than creation for the content of a serial, integrating resource, or multipart monographic work.

items.label: Electrician
items.description: A person responsible for setting up a lighting rig and focusing the lights for a production, and running the lighting at a performance.

items.label: Electrotyper
items.description: A person or organization who creates a duplicate printing surface by pressure molding and electrodepositing of metal that is then backed up with lead for printing.

items.label: Enacting jurisdiction
items.description: A jurisdiction enacting a law, regulation, constitution, court rule, etc.

items.label: Engineer
items.description: A person or organization that is responsible for technical planning and design, particularly with construction.

items.label: Engraver
items.description: A person or organization who cuts letters, figures, etc. on a surface, such as a wooden or metal plate used for printing.

items.label: Etcher
items.description: A person or organization who produces text or images for printing by subjecting metal, glass, or some other surface to acid or the corrosive action of some other substance.

items.label: Event place
items.description: A place where an event such as a conference or a concert took place.

items.label: Expert
items.description: A person or organization in charge of the description and appraisal of the value of goods, particularly rare items, works of art, etc.

items.label: Facsimilist
items.description: A person or organization that executed the facsimile.

items.label: Field director
items.description: A person or organization that manages or supervises the work done to collect raw data or do research in an actual setting or environment (typically applies to the natural and social sciences).

items.label: Film director
items.description: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance.

items.label: Film distributor
items.description: A person, family, or organization involved in distributing a moving image resource to theatres or other distribution channels.

items.label: Film editor
items.description: A person who, following the script and in creative cooperation with the Director, selects, arranges, and assembles the filmed material, controls the synchronization of picture and sound, and participates in other post-production tasks such as sound mixing and visual effects processing. Today, picture editing is often performed digitally.

items.label: Film producer
items.description: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a film.

items.label: Filmmaker
items.description: A person, family or organization responsible for creating an independent or personal film. A filmmaker is individually responsible for the conception and execution of all aspects of the film.

items.label: First party
items.description: A person or organization who is identified as the only party or the party of the first party. In the case of transfer of rights, this is the assignor, transferor, licensor, grantor, etc. Multiple parties can be named jointly as the first party.

items.label: Forger
items.description: A person or organization who makes or imitates something of value or importance, especially with the intent to defraud.

items.label: Former owner
items.description: A person, family, or organization formerly having legal possession of an item.

items.label: Founder
items.description: A person responsible for initiating a diachronic work.

items.label: Funder
items.description: A person or organization that furnished financial support for the production of the work.

items.label: Geographic information specialist
items.description: A person responsible for geographic information system (GIS) development and integration with global positioning system data.

items.label: Honoree
items.description: A person, family, or organization honored by a work or item (e.g., the honoree of a festschrift, a person to whom a copy is presented).

items.label: Host
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) that includes other guests, performers, etc. (e.g., talk show host).

items.label: Host institution
items.description: An organization hosting the event, exhibit, conference, etc., which gave rise to a resource, but having little or no responsibility for the content of the resource.

items.label: Illuminator
items.description: A person providing decoration to a specific item using precious metals or color, often with elaborate designs and motifs.

items.label: Illustrator
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by supplementing the primary content with drawings, diagrams, photographs, etc. If the work is primarily the artistic content created by this entity, use artist or photographer.

items.label: Inscriber
items.description: A person who has written a statement of dedication or gift.

items.label: Instrumentalist
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by playing a musical instrument.

items.label: Interviewee
items.description: A person, family or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by responding to an interviewer, usually a reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent.

items.label: Interviewer
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by acting as an interviewer, reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent.

items.label: Inventor
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new device or process.

items.label: Issuing body
items.description: A person, family or organization issuing a work, such as an official organ of the body.

items.label: Judge
items.description: A person who hears and decides on legal matters in court.

items.label: Jurisdiction governed
items.description: A jurisdiction governed by a law, regulation, etc., that was enacted by another jurisdiction.

items.label: Laboratory
items.description: An organization that provides scientific analyses of material samples.

items.label: Laboratory director
items.description: A person or organization that manages or supervises work done in a controlled setting or environment.

items.label: Landscape architect
items.description: An architect responsible for creating landscape works. This work involves coordinating the arrangement of existing and proposed land features and structures.

items.label: Lead
items.description: A person or organization that takes primary responsibility for a particular activity or endeavor. May be combined with another relator term or code to show the greater importance this person or organization has regarding that particular role. If more than one relator is assigned to a heading, use the Lead relator only if it applies to all the relators.

items.label: Lender
items.description: A person or organization permitting the temporary use of a book, manuscript, etc., such as for photocopying or microfilming.

items.label: Libelant
items.description: A person or organization who files a libel in an ecclesiastical or admiralty case.

items.label: Libelee
items.description: A person or organization against whom a libel has been filed in an ecclesiastical court or admiralty.

items.label: Librettist
items.description: An author of a libretto of an opera or other stage work, or an oratorio.

items.label: Licensee
items.description: A person or organization who is an original recipient of the right to print or publish.

items.label: Licensor
items.description: A person or organization who is a signer of the license, imprimatur, etc.

items.label: Lighting designer
items.description: A person or organization who designs the lighting scheme for a theatrical presentation, entertainment, motion picture, etc.

items.label: Lithographer
items.description: A person or organization who prepares the stone or plate for lithographic printing, including a graphic artist creating a design directly on the surface from which printing will be done.

items.label: Lyricist
items.description: An author of the words of a non-dramatic musical work (e.g. the text of a song), except for oratorios.

items.label: Makeup artist
items.description: A person who contributes to a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation by applying makeup and prosthetics.

items.label: Manufacture place
items.description: The place of manufacture (e.g., printing, duplicating, casting, etc.) of a resource in a published form.

items.label: Manufacturer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for printing, duplicating, casting, etc. a resource.

items.label: Marbler
items.description: The entity responsible for marbling paper, cloth, leather, etc. used in construction of a resource.

items.label: Markup editor
items.description: A person or organization performing the coding of SGML, HTML, or XML markup of metadata, text, etc.

items.label: Medium
items.description: A person held to be a channel of communication between the earthly world and a world of spirits.

items.label: Metadata contact
items.description: A person or organization primarily responsible for compiling and maintaining the original description of a metadata set (e.g., geospatial metadata set).

items.label: Minute taker
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for recording the minutes of a meeting.

items.label: Mixing engineer
items.description: A person or organization contributing to the audio content of a resource by manipulating, mixing and assembling the tracks of an audio recording.

items.label: Moderator
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion.

items.label: Monitor
items.description: A person or organization that supervises compliance with the contract and is responsible for the report and controls its distribution. Sometimes referred to as the grantee, or controlling agency.

items.label: Music copyist
items.description: A person who transcribes or copies musical notation.

items.label: Music programmer
items.description: A person who uses electronic audio devices or computer software to generate sounds.

items.label: Musical director
items.description: A person who coordinates the activities of the composer, the sound editor, and sound mixers for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment.

items.label: Musician
items.description: A person or organization who performs music or contributes to the musical content of a work when it is not possible or desirable to identify the function more precisely.

items.label: Narrator
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by reading or speaking in order to give an account of an act, occurrence, course of events, etc.

items.label: News anchor
items.description: A person who is in overall control of the presentation of a news or current affairs television program.

items.label: Onscreen participant
items.description: A person contributing to a nonfiction moving image work by taking an active role as a participant.

items.label: Onscreen presenter
items.description: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by appearing on screen in nonfiction moving image materials or introductions to fiction moving image materials to provide contextual or background information. Use when another term (e.g., narrator, host) is either not applicable or not desired.

items.label: Opponent
items.description: A person or organization responsible for opposing a thesis or dissertation.

items.label: Organizer
items.description: A person, family, or organization organizing the exhibit, event, conference, etc., which gave rise to a resource.

items.label: Originator
items.description: A person or organization performing the work, i.e., the name of a person or organization associated with the intellectual content of the work. This category does not include the publisher or personal affiliation, or sponsor except where it is also the corporate author.

items.label: Other
items.description: A role that has no equivalent in the MARC list.

items.label: Owner
items.description: A person, family, or organization that currently owns an item or collection, i.e.has legal possession of a resource.

items.label: Panelist
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by participating in a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion.

items.label: Papermaker
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the production of paper, usually from wood, cloth, or other fibrous material.

items.label: Patent applicant
items.description: A person or organization that applied for a patent.

items.label: Patent holder
items.description: A person or organization that was granted the patent referred to by the item.

items.label: Patron
items.description: A person or organization responsible for commissioning a work. Usually a patron uses his or her means or influence to support the work of artists, writers, etc. This includes those who commission and pay for individual works.

items.label: Performer
items.description: A person contributing to a resource by performing music, acting, dancing, speaking, etc., often in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc. If specific codes are used, [prf] is used for a person whose principal skill is not known or specified.

items.label: Permitting agency
items.description: An organization (usually a government agency) that issues permits under which work is accomplished.

items.label: Photographer
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a photographic work.

items.label: Place of address
items.description: The place to which a resource is sent, for example, the place of the postal address of a letter.

items.label: Plaintiff
items.description: A person or organization who brings a suit in a civil proceeding.

items.label: Platemaker
items.description: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by preparing plates used in the production of printed images and/or text.

items.label: Praeses
items.description: A person who is the faculty moderator of an academic disputation, normally proposing a thesis and participating in the ensuing disputation.

items.label: Presenter
items.description: A person or organization mentioned in an “X presents” credit for moving image materials and who is associated with production, finance, or distribution in some way. A vanity credit; in early years, normally the head of a studio.

items.label: Printer
items.description: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of printed text, notated music, etc., from type or plates, such as a book, newspaper, magazine, broadside, score, etc.

items.label: Printer of plates
items.description: A person or organization who prints illustrations from plates.

items.label: Printmaker
items.description: A person or organization who makes a relief, intaglio, or planographic printing surface.

items.label: Process contact
items.description: A person or organization primarily responsible for performing or initiating a process, such as is done with the collection of metadata sets.

items.label: Producer
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for most of the business aspects of a production for screen, audio recording, television, webcast, etc. The producer is generally responsible for fund raising, managing the production, hiring key personnel, arranging for distributors, etc.

items.label: Production company
items.description: An organization that is responsible for financial, technical, and organizational management of a production for stage, screen, audio recording, television, webcast, etc.

items.label: Production designer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for designing the overall visual appearance of a moving image production.

items.label: Production manager
items.description: A person responsible for all technical and business matters in a production.

items.label: Production personnel
items.description: A person or organization associated with the production (props, lighting, special effects, etc.) of a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment.

items.label: Production place
items.description: The place of production (e.g., inscription, fabrication, construction, etc.) of a resource in an unpublished form.

items.label: Programmer
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a computer program.

items.label: Project director
items.description: A person or organization with primary responsibility for all essential aspects of a project, has overall responsibility for managing projects, or provides overall direction to a project manager.

items.label: Proofreader
items.description: A person who corrects printed matter. For manuscripts, use Corrector [crr].

items.label: Provider
items.description: A person or organization who produces, publishes, manufactures, or distributes a resource if specific codes are not desired (e.g. [mfr], [pbl]).

items.label: Publication place
items.description: The place where a resource is published.

items.label: Publisher
items.description: A person or organization responsible for publishing, releasing, or issuing a resource.

items.label: Publishing director
items.description: A person or organization who presides over the elaboration of a collective work to ensure its coherence or continuity. This includes editors-in-chief, literary editors, editors of series, etc.

items.label: Puppeteer
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by manipulating, controlling, or directing puppets or marionettes in a moving image production or a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment.

items.label: Radio director
items.description: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a radio program.

items.label: Radio producer
items.description: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a radio program.

items.label: Rapporteur
items.description: A person responsible for reporting on the proceedings of meetings of an organization.

items.label: Recording engineer
items.description: A person contributing to a resource by supervising the technical aspects of a sound or video recording session.

items.label: Recordist
items.description: A person or organization who uses a recording device to capture sounds and/or video during a recording session, including field recordings of natural sounds, folkloric events, music, etc.

items.label: Redaktor
items.description: A person or organization who writes or develops the framework for an item without being intellectually responsible for its content.

items.label: Remix artist
items.description: A person that manipulates, recombines, mixes and reproduces previously-recorded sounds.

items.label: Renderer
items.description: A person or organization who prepares drawings of architectural designs (i.e., renderings) in accurate, representational perspective to show what the project will look like when completed.

items.label: Reporter
items.description: A person or organization who writes or presents reports of news or current events on air or in print.

items.label: Repository
items.description: An organization that hosts data or material culture objects and provides services to promote long term, consistent and shared use of those data or objects.

items.label: Research team head
items.description: A person who directed or managed a research project.

items.label: Research team member
items.description: A person who participated in a research project but whose role did not involve direction or management of it.

items.label: Researcher
items.description: A person or organization responsible for performing research.

items.label: Respondent
items.description: A person or organization who makes an answer to the courts pursuant to an application for redress (usually in an equity proceeding) or a candidate for a degree who defends or opposes a thesis provided by the praeses in an academic disputation.

items.label: Responsible party
items.description: A person or organization legally responsible for the content of the published material.

items.label: Restager
items.description: A person or organization, other than the original choreographer or director, responsible for restaging a choreographic or dramatic work and who contributes minimal new content.

items.label: Restorationist
items.description: A person, family, or organization responsible for the set of technical, editorial, and intellectual procedures aimed at compensating for the degradation of an item by bringing it back to a state as close as possible to its original condition.

items.label: Reviewer
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the review of a book, motion picture, performance, etc.

items.label: Rubricator
items.description: A person or organization responsible for parts of a work, often headings or opening parts of a manuscript, that appear in a distinctive color, usually red.

items.label: Scenarist
items.description: A person or organization who is the author of a motion picture screenplay, generally the person who wrote the scenarios for a motion picture during the silent era.

items.label: Scientific advisor
items.description: A person or organization who brings scientific, pedagogical, or historical competence to the conception and realization on a work, particularly in the case of audio-visual items.

items.label: Screenwriter
items.description: An author of a screenplay, script, or scene.

items.label: Scribe
items.description: A person who is an amanuensis and for a writer of manuscripts proper. For a person who makes pen-facsimiles, use Facsimilist [fac].

items.label: Sculptor
items.description: An artist responsible for creating a three-dimensional work by modeling, carving, or similar technique.

items.label: Second party
items.description: A person or organization who is identified as the party of the second part. In the case of transfer of right, this is the assignee, transferee, licensee, grantee, etc. Multiple parties can be named jointly as the second party.

items.label: Secretary
items.description: A person or organization who is a recorder, redactor, or other person responsible for expressing the views of a organization.

items.label: Seller
items.description: A former owner of an item who sold that item to another owner.

items.label: Set designer
items.description: A person who translates the rough sketches of the art director into actual architectural structures for a theatrical presentation, entertainment, motion picture, etc. Set designers draw the detailed guides and specifications for building the set.

items.label: Setting
items.description: An entity in which the activity or plot of a work takes place, e.g. a geographic place, a time period, a building, an event.

items.label: Signer
items.description: A person whose signature appears without a presentation or other statement indicative of provenance. When there is a presentation statement, use Inscriber [ins].

items.label: Singer
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by using his/her/their voice, with or without instrumental accompaniment, to produce music. A singer's performance may or may not include actual words.

items.label: Software developer
items.description: A person who researches, designs, implements or tests software.

items.label: Sound designer
items.description: A person who produces and reproduces the sound score (both live and recorded), the installation of microphones, the setting of sound levels, and the coordination of sources of sound for a production.

items.label: Sound engineer
items.description: A person responsible for recording sound on set during filmmaking or television production for inclusion in the finished product, or for use by the sound designer, sound effects editors, or foley artists.

items.label: Speaker
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by speaking words, such as a lecture, speech, etc.

items.label: Special effects provider
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the activities of workers engaged in designing and creating on-set special effects appearing in a moving image or sound recording, such as on-set mechanical effects and in-camera option effects.

items.label: Sponsor
items.description: A person, family, or organization sponsoring some aspect of a resource, e.g., funding research, sponsoring an event.

items.label: Stage director
items.description: A person or organization contributing to a stage resource through the overall management and supervision of a performance.

items.label: Stage manager
items.description: A person who is in charge of everything that occurs on a performance stage, and who acts as chief of all crews and assistant to a director during rehearsals.

items.label: Standards body
items.description: An organization responsible for the development or enforcement of a standard.

items.label: Stereotyper
items.description: A person or organization who creates a new plate for printing by molding or copying another printing surface.

items.label: Storyteller
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by relaying a creator's original story with dramatic or theatrical interpretation.

items.label: Supporting host
items.description: A person or organization that supports (by allocating facilities, staff, or other resources) a project, program, meeting, event, data objects, material culture objects, or other entities capable of support.

items.label: Surveyor
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a cartographic resource by providing measurements or dimensional relationships for the geographic area represented.

items.label: Teacher
items.description: A performer contributing to a resource by giving instruction or providing a demonstration.

items.label: Technical director
items.description: A person who is ultimately in charge of scenery, props, lights and sound for a production.

items.label: Television director
items.description: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a television program.

items.label: Television guest
items.description: A person invited to appear in a television program, often a television talk or variety show. Guests normally appear as themselves or as characters in skits.

items.label: Television host
items.description: A person contributing to a television resource by leading a program that includes other guest, performers, etc.

items.label: Television producer
items.description: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a television program.

items.label: Television writer
items.description: A person contributing to a television resource by writing or collaborating with a group of writers on a script for a television program, such as an episode of a television series.

items.label: Thesis advisor
items.description: A person under whose supervision a degree candidate develops and presents a thesis, mémoire, or text of a dissertation.

items.label: Transcriber
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by changing it from one system of notation to another. For a work transcribed for a different instrument or performing group, see Arranger [arr]. For makers of pen-facsimiles, use Facsimilist [fac].

items.label: Translator
items.description: A person or organization who renders a text from one language into another, or from an older form of a language into the modern form.

items.label: Type designer
items.description: A person or organization who designs the type face used in a particular item.

items.label: Typographer
items.description: A person or organization primarily responsible for choice and arrangement of type used in an item. If the typographer is also responsible for other aspects of the graphic design of a book (e.g., Book designer [bkd]), codes for both functions may be needed.

items.label: University place
items.description: A place where a university that is associated with a resource is located, for example, a university where an academic dissertation or thesis was presented.

items.label: Videographer
items.description: A person in charge of a video production, e.g. the video recording of a stage production as opposed to a commercial motion picture. The videographer may be the camera operator or may supervise one or more camera operators. Do not confuse with cinematographer.

items.label: Visual effects provider
items.description: A person or organization responsible for the activities of workers engaged in designing and creating post-production visual effects appearing in a moving image.

items.label: Voice actor
items.description: An actor contributing to a resource by providing the voice for characters in radio and audio productions and for animated characters in moving image works, as well as by providing voice overs in radio and television commercials, dubbed resources, etc.

items.label: Witness
items.description: Use for a person who verifies the truthfulness of an event or action.

items.label: Wood engraver
items.description: A person or organization who makes prints by cutting the image in relief on the end-grain of a wood block.

items.label: Woodcutter
items.description: A person or organization who makes prints by cutting the image in relief on the plank side of a wood block.

items.label: Writer of accompanying material
items.description: A person or organization who writes significant material which accompanies a sound recording or other audiovisual material.

items.label: Writer of added commentary
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to an expression of a work by providing an interpretation or critical explanation of the original work.

items.label: Writer of added lyrics
items.description: A writer of words added to an expression of a musical work. For lyric writing in collaboration with a composer to form an original work, see lyricist.

items.label: Writer of added text
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a non-textual resource by providing text for the non-textual work (e.g., writing captions for photographs, descriptions of maps).

items.label: Writer of introduction
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing an introduction to the original work.

items.label: Writer of preface
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing a preface to the original work.

items.label: Writer of supplementary textual content
items.description: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing supplementary textual content (e.g., an introduction, a preface) to the original work.
